title: What are some examples of figurative language in songs? - Quora

Songs often use a metaphor referring to the weather. Rain stands for tears or sadness; sunshine for happiness.Stormy Weather - Lena HorneYou Are the Sunshine of My Life - Stevie WonderAin't No Sunshine - Bill Withers Don't Let the Sun Go Down on Me - Elton JohnThunder in My Heart - Leo SayerNo More Rain - Angie StoneRain on Me - Ashanti Mountains and seas or water can be symbols for obstacles, sometimes separating two lovers.Ain't No Mountain High Enough - Marvin Gaye & Tammi TerrellBridge over Troubled Water - Simon & GarfunkelGet Here - Oleta AdamsClimbing - Lionel Richie Fire can be a metaphor for passion or war.Ring of Fire - Johnny CashLight My Fire - The DoorsWe Didn't Start the Fire - Billy JoelI'm on Fire - Bruce SpringsteenBeds Are Burning - Midnight Oil Other metaphors:El Condor Pasa - Simon & Garfunkel ("I'd rather be a hammer than a nail")Heart of gold - Neil Young ("I've been a miner for a heart of gold.")One Day I'll Fly Away - Randy CrawfordGenie in a Bottle - Christina AguileraHuman Nature - Michael Jackson ("If this town is just an apple then let me take a bite.") Similes with animals:Hound Dog - Elvis PresleyEagle - ABBAI'm Like a Bird - Nelly FurtadoRoar - Katy Perry Other similes:Like a Rolling Stone - Bob DylanI Am a Rock - Paul SimonSkyscraper - Demi LovatoWrecking Ball - Miley Cyrus Love can be compared to a flower etc.The Rose - Bette MidlerLove Is the Drug - Roxy MusicYour Love Is King - SadeOne - U2 ("Love is a temple, love a higher law") Personification:While My Guitar Gently Weeps - The BeatlesTheme from "New York, New York" - Liza Minnelli ("These vagabond shoes are longing to stray.") Hyperbole:I'm Gonna Be (500 Miles) - The ProclaimersA Thousand Miles - Vanessa CarltonAs - Stevie Wonder ("until the ocean covers every mountain high") Oxymoron:It's Hard to Be Tender - Carly SimonBittersweet Symphony - The Verve Onomatopoeia:Old MacDonald Had a FarmBoom Boom - John Lee Hooker Bang Bang - CherTik Tok - Kesha
